questions.question_text: Max has either a cola or lemonade at morning tea break. If he has cola one morning, the probability he has cola the next is 0.3. If he has lemonade one morning, the probability he has lemonade the next is 0.4. Suppose he has lemonade on a Monday morning. What is the probability that he has cola on the following Wednesday morning?
questions.detailed_answer: The transition matrix representing this situation is 1 10.3 0.6 0.7 0.4ii i iCL C L+ +⎡⎤ ⎢⎥⎣⎻ So having cola on the Wednesday could come from two cases, LLC or LCC. Pr ( ) Pr ( ) 1 0.4 0.6 1 0.6 0.3 0.24 0.18 0.42LLC LCC+ =× × +× ×=+=
